ARABIC: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: In the daytime much of your time is taken up by business matters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Indeed during the day you have a long schedule of occupations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You are indeed much occupied during the day with the affairs of the world.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: During the day, you are preoccupied with many activities.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed you have a lot of matters during the day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, for you in the day is lengthy Sabh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely you have in the day time a long occupation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: surely in the day thou hast long business.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! thou hast by day a chain of business.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: You have by day prolonged occupations [with Dawah work].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily there is for thee by day occupation prolonged.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: for indeed during the day you have drawn-out engagements.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: True, there is for thee by day prolonged occupation with ordinary duties:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, there is for you by day prolonged occupation with ordinary duties,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: You have by day prolonged occupations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: In the daytime, you have lengthy work to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [73:7] [For] assuredly during the day you have extended engagements, administering your affairs, and you do not have the time to recite Qur’ān.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! thou hast by day) Muhammad (a chain of business) a long period of time to attend to your needs.
